duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform in-person Veteran Medical Examinations to evaluate and diagnose general medical health conditions to support a Veteran's disability claim.
Gather and synthesize clinical evidence through medical and military record review, interviews with Veterans, and face-to-face examinations.
Develop a medical opinion of the likelihood that the Veteran's condition is related to their military service.
Provide C&P (Compensation & Pension) services to Veterans, including health histories, assessments, and diagnostic testing.
Prepare timely, unbiased, and complete documentation of all Veteran care as provided by law, regulation, and established policy.
Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulations.
Exhibit a high degree of courtesy, tact, and poise when interacting with Veterans, families, and other healthcare professionals.
Participate in continuing education to stay abreast of current technologies/practices.
Adjust to fluctuating volume while maintaining quality, timeliness, and customer service.
Perform other related duties as assigned by management.

education_certification.credential: Master's Degree in Nursing or Physician Assistant Studies from an accredited program
Active and unrestricted NP/PA license in the state in which exams are performed.
